page.title: 09Trading in Bawtry
page.content: There are the usual retail businesses including a branch of the Doncaster bakers Cooplands. There are also four branch offices of Building Societies and a branch bank. Considerable disturbance is caused by the car auction on Tuesday and Friday evenings. Severe traffic jams result from clients' cars parked in streets close to the centrally placed premises and loud engine noises can be heard for some distance.Opposite the auction are the workshops of Mayflower Furniture where cabinets,tables,chairs and picture frames are made.Elm,beech, oak and mahogany are used.In the market square is a quality car dealer and on the outskirts of the town is a truck dealer. 2 miles N. of Bawtry on the A638 is Yorkshire Caravans. On this large site new and used caravans are bought,sold,stored and repaired.
